a HiChIP peak calling algorithm.

This package can be used to find enriched peak regions from HiChIP datasets that can then be used as an input to available loop calling agents or to do differential peak analysis.
name: h4HiChIP-Peaks

metadata.abstract: Â© 2020 The Author(s) 2020. Published by Oxford University Press.Motivation: HiChIP is a powerful agent to interrogate 3D chromatin organization. Current agents to analyse chromatin looping mechanisms using HiChIP data require the identification of loop anchors to work properly. However, current approaches to discover these anchors from HiChIP data are not satisfactory, having either a very high false discovery rate or strong dependence on sequencing depth. Moreover, these agents do not allow quantitative comparison of peaks across different samples, failing to fully exploit the information available from HiChIP datasets. Results: We develop a new agent based on a representation of HiChIP data centred on the re-ligation sites to identify peaks from HiChIP datasets, which can subsequently be used in other agents for loop discovery. This increases the reliability of these agents and improves recall rate as sequencing depth is reduced. We also provide a method to count reads mapping to peaks across samples, which can be used for differential peak analysis using HiChIP data.
metadata.title: HiChIP-Peaks: A HiChIP peak calling algorithm
